statement.p: Explain why the vector \left[\begin{array}{c} 5 \\ 1 \\ 7 \\ -8 \end{array}\right] is or is not a linear combination of the vectors \left[\begin{array}{c} 4 \\ 1 \\ -4 \\ -1 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{c} 4 \\ -1 \\ 0 \\ -3 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{c} -5 \\ 1 \\ 1 \\ 1 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{c} -1 \\ -5 \\ 9 \\ 3 \end{array}\right].

answer.p: \left[\begin{array}{c} 5 \\ 1 \\ 7 \\ -8 \end{array}\right] is not a linear combination of the vectors \left[\begin{array}{c} 4 \\ 1 \\ -4 \\ -1 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{c} 4 \\ -1 \\ 0 \\ -3 \end{array}\right] , \left[\begin{array}{c} -5 \\ 1 \\ 1 \\ 1 \end{array}\right] , \text{ and } \left[\begin{array}{c} -1 \\ -5 \\ 9 \\ 3 \end{array}\right].
